timeline.bodyText: given that we already handle the disposition updates via the CommandContext, I wonder if it wouldn't be more consistent (and elegant) to provide a closeConsumer() method in CommandContext instead of passing in the MessageConsumer as an extra argument. WDYT?

replies.bodyText:
Well, the new CommandContext.consumer field for that couldn't be final (the CommandContext is not necessarily tied to a consumer as of now) and would need to be set later on. In that sense I don't see the consumer object naturally belonging in the CommandContext.
But we could use a new CommandContext sub class with that field (or use composition).
I need to think about this. In any case, I would rather do this in a separate PR.
